text: Hey! thank you both, now it is solved :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi everyone.

Does anyone have issues with display in HubSpot? Some odd views happened since 3 days.

Hello,
I am currently building an app that integrates HubSpot with an external app. My external app needs an API Key in each request to process authenticated actions.
The integration app should mostly be used in CRM cards and for now the only solution I see is sending the key in each action which seems a bit tedious for the client cause the client would have to fill in their API key every time.
I would like to persist this API Key on HubSpot's side but I can't find how to do it.
Is there a solution to persist this API Key in such app's settings or something like this ?

Thanks
<@U07T6DCCMTQ> , you’ll need enterprise but I think you’ll want to store that as a secret on the HS side of things and then reference that secret’s name in code

Sorry, I should have replied in this thread. You can store a 'secret' in HubSpot but you do need Enterprise. Here's more infomation:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/serverless-functions#create-a-serverless-function>
Just do a search on that page for "secret" and it should point you in the right direction
Pretty new to this group, and I am not sure which channel is for integration, though. Doing this AMA for HubSpot Quickbooks Integration <https://streamyard.com/watch/mUrD7VhvUM4u> Do check it out

Exactly, I want to be able to recover those credentials/key stored in HS from my app code.

Is there no possibility to save those necessary credentials through an initial configuration for the user of my app?

Thanks for your response Jeff. I have one last question. This doc is for those who want to develop a private app. In my case I am building a public app that I want to upload to the HB marketplace. Do you know if it is the same for this case?

Is there no possibility to save those necessary credentials through an initial configuration for the user who installs the application?

Hey <@U07T6DCCMTQ> - I don't have experience on the Public app side but in that document, on the left side, you'll see a section for public apps on the left. I did find this page as well: <https://app.HubSpot.com/developer-docs-app-en-us/guides/crm/public-apps/fetching-data>

There's a callout in there that seems to allude to using your own backend: "Please note: `HubSpot.fetch()` does not support request and response headers. The HubSpot signature must be used to perform authentication/authorization in your back-end. For security reasons, you should not store secrets in your React code to communicate with third-party back-ends. Instead, use your own back-end to fetch data from other third-party APIs after <https://app.HubSpot.com/developer-docs-app-en-us/guides/apps/authentication/validating-requests|validating the HubSpot signature> on the request."
